rows.text_1_facilitator: We know how stressful it is to bring up teenagers in these times. Learning to manage your stress helps you – and your family.

text_1_facilitator.eng: We know how stressful it is to bring up teenagers in these times. Learning to manage your stress helps you – and your family.

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings everyone.

Today's topic is managing stress.

It is important to know how to manage our stress. At times our children can behave in ways that make us feel stressed and us as parents can make our children feel stressed too.

So, it is important to notice when we feel stressed and take a pause and breathe. That will help you manage your stress.

rows.media_transcript:
Greetings everyone.

Today's topic is managing stress.

It is important to know how to manage our stress. At times our children can behave in ways that make us feel stressed and us as parents can make our children feel stressed too.

So, it is important to notice when we feel stressed and take a pause and breathe. That will help you manage your stress.

media_transcript.eng:
Life is tough sometimes. Before I joined ParentApp, I used to be grumpy at all times. I would take out my anger on everyone at home, not only my teens but even my husband as well. They would run away when I came home because they knew I would start yelling at them.

Learning to take a pause and breathe was difficult at first. But every time I tried it, it helped me to calm down. Now my teens are no longer running away when I come home and they actually listen better than when I used to shout at them!

rows.media_transcript:
Life is tough sometimes. Before I joined ParentApp, I used to be grumpy at all times. I would take out my anger on everyone at home, not only my teens but even my husband as well. They would run away when I came home because they knew I would start yelling at them.

Learning to take a pause and breathe was difficult at first. But every time I tried it, it helped me to calm down. Now my teens are no longer running away when I come home and they actually listen better than when I used to shout at them!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s look at an example of how stress can sometimes just get too much, for all of us:

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s look at an example of how stress can sometimes just get too much, for all of us:

text_2.eng: Baba lost his job. He was sitting at home feeling frustrated and stressed, when Joshua entered.

rows.text_2: Baba lost his job. He was sitting at home feeling frustrated and stressed, when Joshua entered.

rows.character_1_text: Can I have money to buy some airtime?

character_1_text.eng: Can I have money to buy some airtime?

character_2_text.eng: Leave me alone and mind your own business!

rows.character_2_text: Leave me alone and mind your own business!

rows.character_1_text: What did I do? You never listen!

character_1_text.eng: What did I do? You never listen!

character_2_text.eng: I said leave me alone or you will get a beating!

rows.character_2_text: I said leave me alone or you will get a beating!

rows.character_1_text: Look! I have made a house!

character_1_text.eng: Look! I have made a house!

rows.character_2_text: Who cares about your stupid house!

character_2_text.eng: Who cares about your stupid house!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let's think about what happened in this story.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let's think about what happened in this story.

quiz_1_question.eng: How do you think male_child_name_2 felt?

quiz_4_question.eng: What could Baba have done differently?

quiz_4_option_2_text.eng: Take a deep breath and speak calmly

quiz_4_option_3_text.eng: Show he understands his teen's feelings

quiz_4_option_4_text.eng: Think about solutions together with male_child_name_2

quiz_4_option_5_text.eng: Do something positive together with male_child_name_2

rows.quiz_1_question: How do you think male_child_name_2 felt?
rows.quiz_4_question: What could Baba have done differently?
rows.quiz_4_option_2_text: Take a deep breath and speak calmly
rows.quiz_4_option_3_text: Show he understands his teen's feelings
rows.quiz_4_option_4_text: Think about solutions together with male_child_name_2
rows.quiz_4_option_5_text: Do something positive together with male_child_name_2

rows.text_1_facilitator: Thank you for thinking along! Let’s go back in time and see what Baba does now:

text_1_facilitator.eng: Thank you for thinking along! Let’s go back in time and see what Baba does now:

text_2.eng: Baba lost his job. He was sitting at home feeling frustrated and stressed, when male_child_name_2 entered.

character_1_text.eng: Can I have money to buy some airtime?

character_2_text.eng: (taking a breath): I’m sorry son. I had a difficult day today. The boss fired me.

rows.text_2: Baba lost his job. He was sitting at home feeling frustrated and stressed, when male_child_name_2 entered.
rows.character_1_text: Can I have money to buy some airtime?
rows.character_2_text: (taking a breath): I’m sorry son. I had a difficult day today. The boss fired me.

rows.character_1_text: Oh no! I need a new school uniform.

character_1_text.eng: Oh no! I need a new school uniform.

character_2_text.eng: I’ll try, son, and your Mama’s job will help us get by while I look for another job.

rows.character_2_text: I’ll try, son, and your Mama’s job will help us get by while I look for another job.

rows.character_1_text: I can help out with looking for work, too, Baba?

character_1_text.eng: I can help out with looking for work, too, Baba?

character_2_text.eng: No it’s okay, male_child_name_2. I appreciate your offer. The most important thing is that you work hard at school. Thanks for listening to me.

rows.character_2_text: No it’s okay, male_child_name_2. I appreciate your offer. The most important thing is that you work hard at school. Thanks for listening to me.

rows.character_1_text: Let’s play some soccer together. It will help me get this stress off my mind for a bit.

character_1_text.eng: Let’s play some soccer together. It will help me get this stress off my mind for a bit.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Think back to when you were a teenager.

Was there ever a time when you were in danger but you could not tell your family because they would have been angry?

This ALMOST happened to male_child_name_2 and female_child_name_5! Let’s have a look:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Think back to when you were a teenager.

Was there ever a time when you were in danger but you could not tell your family because they would have been angry?

This ALMOST happened to male_child_name_2 and female_child_name_5! Let’s have a look:

character_1_text.eng: Don’t tell the adults, but I am going to bar with my friends tonight.

character_2_text.eng: Have fun! I have told them I am staying with my girlfriend, but I am actually going to a cool party.

rows.character_1_text: Don’t tell the adults, but I am going to bar with my friends tonight.
rows.character_2_text: Have fun! I have told them I am staying with my girlfriend, but I am actually going to a cool party.

rows.character_1_text: I think they are dealing drugs. We could all get arrested. But I can’t tell my parents – they will be so angry!

character_1_text.eng: I think they are dealing drugs. We could all get arrested. But I can’t tell my parents – they will be so angry!

character_2_text.eng: I am scared. Everyone is too drunk to drive me home. This boy says he will take me but he wants us to go to his house first. I can’t tell my parents – I lied about coming to this party.

rows.character_2_text: I am scared. Everyone is too drunk to drive me home. This boy says he will take me but he wants us to go to his house first. I can’t tell my parents – I lied about coming to this party.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
These are dangerous situations! Thankfully, male_child_name_2 and  female_child_name_5 then remembered what Baba told them:

"I care about your safety more than anything. If you are ever upset, or scared, you can always call me for help, or tell me about it.

Shall we use an imaginary ‘Aunty Cecilia’ as Safety Word? Just say something about Aunty Cecilia, I promise that I will try my best to help and I will not be angry – even if you are doing something you should not."

text_1_facilitator.eng:
These are dangerous situations! Thankfully, male_child_name_2 and  female_child_name_5 then remembered what Baba told them:

"I care about your safety more than anything. If you are ever upset, or scared, you can always call me for help, or tell me about it.

Shall we use an imaginary ‘Aunty Cecilia’ as Safety Word? Just say something about Aunty Cecilia, I promise that I will try my best to help and I will not be angry – even if you are doing something you should not."

character_1_text.eng: Baba, how is Aunty Cecilia doing now?

character_2_text.eng: (on the other side of the phone) Not well. We need you at home. I will come pick you up right away. Where are you?

rows.character_1_text: Baba, how is Aunty Cecilia doing now?
rows.character_2_text: (on the other side of the phone) Not well. We need you at home. I will come pick you up right away. Where are you?

rows.character_1_text:
(thinking: I think my friends are in trouble. I don’t want to stop being their friend, but I’m worried. Maybe Baba knows what to do.)

"Baba, I just remembered, Aunty Cecilia said she will come visit tomorrow."

character_1_text.eng:
(thinking: I think my friends are in trouble. I don’t want to stop being their friend, but I’m worried. Maybe Baba knows what to do.)

"Baba, I just remembered, Aunty Cecilia said she will come visit tomorrow."

character_2_text.eng: (on the other side of the phone): Okay, I need you at home to help get things ready. I will come pick you up now. Where are you?

rows.character_2_text: (on the other side of the phone): Okay, I need you at home to help get things ready. I will come pick you up now. Where are you?

rows.text_1_facilitator:
You can choose any word as a Safety Word. Only your family knows it means ‘help’.

Your teen can say this word to let you know they are in trouble without you getting angry or punishing them, so you can help them.

What Safety Word can you choose with your teen? Here are some ideas from other families:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
You can choose any word as a Safety Word. Only your family knows it means ‘help’.

Your teen can say this word to let you know they are in trouble without you getting angry or punishing them, so you can help them.

What Safety Word can you choose with your teen? Here are some ideas from other families:

text_2.eng:
A specific food
A specific family member
A specific animal
Something else

rows.text_2:
A specific food
A specific family member
A specific animal
Something else

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are this week’s takeaway skills!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are this week’s takeaway skills!

section_1_text.eng:
Breathe. Slowly. Pause.

Before you say anything, slowly breathe in and out five times. It will calm you, and give you a chance to think.

section_2_text.eng:
Share how you feel.

This is hard. Many of us were told not to cry, or show our feelings to our children. But take a deep breath and calmly tell them how you feel. They will understand better, and also learn from you how to deal with stress.

section_3_text.eng:
Show them you care.

This is also hard! Stress makes us focus on ourselves. But our teens need our support. Ask them how they feel. Listen to them and comfort them. Try a hug or say "I understand". It can change everything.

section_4_text.eng:
Seek the positive.

Can you and your teen think about ideas that might help? Can you do something positive together to take your mind off the stress?

section_4_extra_text.eng: If all else fails, breathe. You can do this.

rows.section_1_text:
Breathe. Slowly. Pause.

Before you say anything, slowly breathe in and out five times. It will calm you, and give you a chance to think.
rows.section_2_text:
Share how you feel.

This is hard. Many of us were told not to cry, or show our feelings to our children. But take a deep breath and calmly tell them how you feel. They will understand better, and also learn from you how to deal with stress.
rows.section_3_text:
Show them you care.

This is also hard! Stress makes us focus on ourselves. But our teens need our support. Ask them how they feel. Listen to them and comfort them. Try a hug or say "I understand". It can change everything.
rows.section_4_text:
Seek the positive.

Can you and your teen think about ideas that might help? Can you do something positive together to take your mind off the stress?
rows.section_4_extra_text: If all else fails, breathe. You can do this.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
There are two home practices for this week:

1) Whenever you are feeling stressed or upset: take five breaths in and out before you react. And when you're both calm, share with your teen how you feel.

2) Choose a "Safety Word" with your teenager, and think of a situation together when you could use this.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
There are two home practices for this week:

1) Whenever you are feeling stressed or upset: take five breaths in and out before you react. And when you're both calm, share with your teen how you feel.

2) Choose a "Safety Word" with your teenager, and think of a situation together when you could use this.

media_transcript.eng:
Whenever I would do something wrong, my father would get so angry at me and beat me. He would not even listen to me and I would get so angry as well at him and everyone else.

Now, when he gets angry, he first takes a few deep breaths before he responds. It makes everyone calm down instead of causing a big fight.

It really helped me at home and at school, because even me I am no longer slashing everyone and I am no longer this moody person. When I feel really angry or stressed, I also take deep breaths like my father does. I am a different person.

rows.media_transcript:
Whenever I would do something wrong, my father would get so angry at me and beat me. He would not even listen to me and I would get so angry as well at him and everyone else.

Now, when he gets angry, he first takes a few deep breaths before he responds. It makes everyone calm down instead of causing a big fight.

It really helped me at home and at school, because even me I am no longer slashing everyone and I am no longer this moody person. When I feel really angry or stressed, I also take deep breaths like my father does. I am a different person.
